intro: Sida rhombifolia var. microphylla, commonly known as small-leaved horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its small, rhombic-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it adaptable to different habitats, contributing to its widespread distribution.
